attack.name: ataque
attack.description: You perform a melee or ranged attack.

equipment.name: equipar
equipment.description:
You switch any number of equipped items with any number of items in your backpack.
* This action doesn't apply to armor.

hinder.name: atrapalhar
hinder.description: You perform a Check (DL 10) against an opponent. If you succeed, you inflict dazed, shaken, slow, or weak upon them.

inventory.name: inventário
inventory.description: You spend Inventory Points to produce and immediately use a consumable item.

objective.name: objetivo
objective.description:
You work towards accomplishing an objective within the conflict.
* This will require an Attribute Check or Opposed Check.
* Complex goals will often require a Clock.

spell.name: feitiço
spell.description: You cast one of the spells you have learned.

study.name: estudar
study.description:
You attempt to gain information about someone or something.
* This will generally require an【INS + INS】 Open Check

skill.name: habilidade
skill.description: Some Skills require you to spend an action.

ritual.name: ritual
ritual.description:
Ritual magic should never be able to accomplish any of the following:
* Causing direct damage. The Ritual can still deal collateral damage — if you open a chasm below your enemies' feet, they are bound to suffer some kind of harm.
When establishing collateral damage dealt by a Ritual, use the table on page 93.
* Inflicting or removing status effects.
* Causing characters to lose or gain HP, MP, IP, Fabula Points or Ultima Points.
* Replicating the mechanical benefits of an existing spell or Skill (however, narrative effects such as teleportation of flight are okay, even if some Skills do grant them).
* Generating creatures or equipment, or granting them permanent abilities.

other.name: outras
other.description: You perform an action that is not covered by any of the above, negotiating its resolution and effects with the Game Master.
